channel.title: Posts on MOTE Effect Size Calculator
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on MOTE Effect Size Calculator

item.title: Introduction
item.description: Effect sizes broadly fall into two categories: 1) Mean differences: normally represented by Z or d, usually the standardized difference between two means. 2) Variance overlap: normally representated by eta/omega, r-squared, or V, usually the amount of variance in the DV accounted for by the IV(s). Overall, we can think about effect sizes as a measure of the magnitude of an phenomenon. Unlike p-values, effect size is not as confounded by sample size.

item.title: Tests
